starters.title: Vegtable Soup
starters.briefDescription: not a beautiful dish of spaghetti
starters.fullDescription:
A handsome and flavourful Indian dish with a powerful and entrancing scent that hangs in the air after cooking.
This dish can be prepared in near countless different ways, but each way is sure to have your taste buds dancing in delight. It can be seasoned and spiced to your liking so whether you prefer a mild-mannered meal or a dinner that's blow your head off hot, there's a version out there for each and every palate to enjoy

mains.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
mains.fullDescription:
A handsome and flavourful Indian dish with a powerful and entrancing scent that hangs in the air after cooking.
This dish can be prepared in near countless different ways, but each way is sure to have your taste buds dancing in delight. It can be seasoned and spiced to your liking so whether you prefer a mild-mannered meal or a dinner that's blow your head off hot, there's a version out there for each and every palate to enjoy
steps: Add a small drop of olive oil to your oven ready pot and let it sit on a medium heat

Season your mince with a sprinkling of each of the seasonings above and just a dash of Cayenne.
Mix this thorougly so to spread the seasoning around and to break the mince up fully then add this to your pot once the oil reaches it's medium heat.
Place the lid on the pot and let it cook slowly making sure to stir it every few minutes so it doesn't stick.

On a seperate pan place a decent plop of olive oil and bring to a high heat.
Slice you bacon vertically down the centre, layer the two halves on top of each other then slice thin strips horizontally.
Place your small strips of bacon on the pan and stir regularly until crispy.

Remove your bacon from the pan and take your pan off the heat. Place on a thin sheet of kitchen paper to remove any excess oil then put your bacon in the pot with your mince and stir before putting the lid back on the pot.

Add another plop of oil to the pan you cooked your bacon in and bring it back to a high heat. Place your finely chopped onions, peppers and mushrooms and stir regularly.
Feel free to add a light seasoning to your taste. Give these a light fry for around 5-10 minutes.
Once your veg is ready pour it all directly into the pot and stir.
Open your tin of kidney beans and drain the liquid inside. Pour directly into your pot and stir.
Open your tin of chopped tomatoes. Pour directly into your pot and stir.
Open you jar of pasta sauce. Pour directly into your pot and stir.
Crush your garlice into a paste and add it to the pot and stir.
Add another layer of seasoning, give it another stir to make sure it's all mixed.
Place your pot inside a preheated oven at 180â„ƒ for around an hour, stirring the pot every 20 minutes or so.

mains.title: Curry
mains.briefDescription: A flavourful, aromatic dish that can be spiced to suit any palate
mains.fullDescription:
A handsome and flavourful Indian dish with a powerful and entrancing scent that hangs in the air after cooking.
This dish can be prepared in near countless different ways, but each way is sure to have your taste buds dancing in delight. It can be seasoned and spiced to your liking so whether you prefer a mild-mannered meal or a dinner that's blow your head off hot, there's a version out there for each and every palate to enjoy
steps: Slice your chicken fillets vertically down their centre then slice those halves horizontally every half inch, then place your chopped chicken in a mixing bowl
Slice your bacon vertically down their centre, place these halves on top of each other then slice horizontally every quarter inch, then add these bacon bits to your mixing bowl
Add a sprinkling of each of your seasonings as well as a drop of olive oil to your bowl and mix thoroughly so that the seasoning is spread evenly
Add a drop of oil to your pot and place your pot on a medium to high heat
Pour the contents of your mixing bowl into your pot once it's at heat and stir every few minutes
Add your kidney beans and diced onions and peppers to your pot once your chicken is cooked the whole way through and looks tender
Stir regularly until onions and peppers are soft
Add a curry sauce of your choosing to the pot and stir
If the curry is in need of some more body add a quarter cup of water to the jar of curry, place the lid back on and shake then add this to the pot
Add another round of your seasonings and stir
Place the lip on top of your pot and place on a low heat and let sit for around an hour, stirring every 15 minutes
Rinse your rice under cold water 15 minutes before the curry is ready, season with salt and pepper and place in a pot of cold water and place a lid on your pot
Heat your rice and maximum heat until the water is at a full boil
Take your rice off the heat then place over a low heat for 8-12 minutes, removing it from the heat whenever it starts to boild over. Do not remove the lid
Strain your rice and plate up
Add 3 or 4 spoons of curry on top of your rice and enjoy!

Rinse your rice under cold water 15 minutes before the curry is ready, season with salt and pepper and place in a pot of cold water and place a lid on your pot
Heat your rice and maximum heat until the water is at a full boil
Take your rice off the heat then place over a low heat for 8-12 minutes, removing it from the heat whenever it starts to boild over. Do not remove the lid
